0.description: Meteorite badges are common and easy to earn when just getting started.
0.label: Meteorite

1.description: Moon badges are uncommon and represent an investment in learning.
1.label: Moon

2.description: Earth badges are rare. They require a significant amount of learning.
2.label: Earth

3.description: Sun badges are epic. Earning them is a true challenge, and they require impressive dedication.
3.label: Sun

4.description: Black Hole badges are legendary and unknown. They are the most unique Khan Academy awards.
4.label: Black Hole

5.description: Challenge Patches are special awards for completing topic challenges.
5.label: Challenge Patches

0.description: Context-less badges, which means they can only be earned once.
0.name: NONE

1.description: Exercise badges (can earn one for every Exercise).
1.name: EXERCISE

3.description: Feedback badges (one for every piece of discussion Feedback).
3.name: FEEDBACK

4.description: Earned for computer science specific actions.
4.name: CS

topic_exercise_badges.description: Achieve proficiency in all skills in

0.description: For badges that can be earned (by the feedback author) by having a feedback item that gets voted on.
0.name: VOTEE

1.description: For badges that can be earned (by the author) by posting a feedback item.
1.name: POST

2.description: Earned by creating a brand new scratchpad.
2.name: NEW_SCRATCHPAD

3.description: Earned by forking another user's scratchpad.
3.name: FORK_SCRATCHPAD

4.description: Earned by having a scratchpad forked.
4.name: GET_FORKED

5.description: For badges that can be earned by sharing a scratchpad
5.name: SCRATCHPAD_SHARE

6.description: For badges that can be earned by finishing watching a scratchpad tutorial
6.name: SCRATCHPAD_FINISH_TUTORIAL

description: Cache of badge meta data generated bytools/parse_badges.py for use by dashboard.khanacademy.org when serving information about badges. Example usage can be found at dashboards.khanacademy.org/badges
